templates.name: {{.logicalClusterId}}
group_order: How should we connect to your data?
Number of tasks for this connector

config_defs.name: tasks.max
config_defs.group: Number of tasks for this connector
config_defs.documentation: Maximum number of tasks for the connector.

config_defs.name: output.data.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the output Kafka record value format. Valid entries are AVRO, JSON_SR, or PROTOBUF. Please configure Confluent Cloud Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: api.chaining.parent.child.relationship
config_defs.documentation: Comma separated list of parent-child relationship in case of API Chaining. For ex - If api1 is the parent API, and api2,api3 are the child APIs of api1, then the value will be set to ``api1::api2,api1::api3``.

config_defs.name: api1.topics
config_defs.documentation: The name of the Kafka topics to publish data to.

config_defs.name: api1.http.request.method
config_defs.documentation: HTTP Request Method. Valid options are `GET` and `POST`.

config_defs.name: api1.http.request.parameters
config_defs.documentation: HTTP parameters to be added to each request. Parameter names and values should be separated by ``=``. Distinct parameters should be separated by ``&``. Parameter values can be templated with offset information (for example: ``search_after=${offset}``) where ``${offset}`` will be substituted with the offset generated from the previous request's response (or if it's the first request, from 'http.initial.offset'). The parameters are only set if 'http.request.method' = `GET`.

config_defs.name: api1.http.request.body
config_defs.documentation: The payload to be sent along with each HTTP request. The value can be templated with offset (for example: ``search_after: ${offset}``) where ``${offset}`` will be substituted with the offset generated from the previous request's response (or if it's the first request, from 'http.initial.offset'). The body is only set if 'http.request.method' = `POST`.

config_defs.name: api1.http.offset.mode
config_defs.documentation: This config indicates how offsets are computed and how requests are generated. If set to ``SIMPLE_INCREMENTING``, the ${offset} used to generate requests is simply the previous offset (or ``http.initial.offset``) incremented by 1 per sourced record. In this mode, ``http.initial.offset`` needs to be set to an integer value. If set to ``CHAINING``, the config 'http.offset.json.pointer' needs to be set, and the offset for a record is set to the value for the configured key in the response data. If the value is ``CURSOR_PAGINATION``, then the config 'http.next.page.json.pointer' needs to be set and the offset for the last record in each page will be set to the next page value. If set to ``SNAPSHOT_PAGINATION``, only the config 'http.offset.json.pointer' needs to be set.

config_defs.name: api1.http.initial.offset
config_defs.documentation: The initial offset to be used to generate the first request. This needs to be set if either one or more of the configs - 'url', 'http.request.parameters', or 'http.request.body' contain the template variable ``${offset}``.

config_defs.name: api1.http.response.data.json.pointer
config_defs.documentation: The JSON Pointer to the entity in the JSON response containing the actual data that should be written to Kafka as records. The entity can be an array (multiple records in a single response) or an object / scalar value (single record).

config_defs.name: api1.http.offset.json.pointer
config_defs.documentation: The JSON Pointer to the value in each record that corresponds to the offset for that record (it is relative to 'http.response.data.json.pointer'). The offset will be available to the subsequent request as ${offset} and it will also be used for checkpointing and recovery in case of connector failures or restarts. This config should only be set if 'http.offset.mode' is set to ``CHAINING``.

config_defs.name: api1.http.next.page.json.pointer
config_defs.documentation: The JSON pointer to the value in the response which corresponds to the next page reference (either a page token, a full URL or a URL fragment). This will be stored as the offset and will be available to the subsequent request via the template variable ${offset}. This config should only be set if 'http.offset.mode' is set to ``CURSOR_PAGINATION``.

config_defs.name: api1.request.interval.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait between consecutive requests.

config_defs.name: api1.http.response.schema
config_defs.documentation: HTTP response schema parsed from the swagger spec.

config_defs.name: api1.enable.cursor.pagination.with.timestamp.mode
config_defs.documentation: Whether to use cursor pagination with timestamp mode.

config_defs.name: api1.http.timestamp.json.pointer
config_defs.display_name: JSON pointer to the timestamp field in the response.
config_defs.documentation: JSON pointer to the timestamp field in the response. It is used to construct time related parameters for the subsequent API calls.

config_defs.name: api1.initial.start.timestamp.value
config_defs.documentation: The initial start timestamp to be used to generate the first request. This needs to be set when using cursor.pagination.with.timestamp.mode

config_defs.name: api1.http.cursor.pagination.parameter.name
config_defs.display_name: Name of the cursor pagination request parameter
config_defs.documentation: Name of the request parameter which holds the next page token.

config_defs.name: api1.initial.end.timestamp.value
config_defs.documentation: The initial end timestamp to be used to generate the first request. This needs to be set when using cursor.pagination.with.timestamp.mode

config_defs.name: api1.timestamp.format
config_defs.documentation: Timestamp format used in the time related request parameters. It should match the format of initial.start.timestamp.value and initial.end.timestamp.value

config_defs.name: api1.timestamp.interval.format
config_defs.documentation: Format of the timestamp interval provided.

config_defs.name: api1.http.timestamp.interval
config_defs.documentation: Timestamp interval between start time and end time.

config_defs.name: api1.time.range.request.delay
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait between consecutive time range requests in timestamp mode with cursor pagination.

config_defs.name: api6.http.response.data.json.pointer
config_defs.documentation: The JSON Pointer to the entity in the JSON response containing the actual data that should be written to Kafka as records. The entity can be an array (multiple records in a single response) or an object / scalar value (single record).

config_defs.name: api6.http.offset.json.pointer
config_defs.documentation: The JSON Pointer to the value in each record that corresponds to the offset for that record (it is relative to 'http.response.data.json.pointer'). config_defs.name: api12.topics
config_defs.documentation: The name of the Kafka topics to publish data to.

config_defs.name: api12.http.request.method
config_defs.documentation: HTTP Request Method. Valid options are `GET` and `POST`.

config_defs.name: api12.http.request.parameters
config_defs.documentation: HTTP parameters to be added to each request. Parameter names and values should be separated by ``=``. Distinct parameters should be separated by ``&``. Parameter values can be templated with offset information (for example: ``search_after=${offset}``) where ``${offset}`` will be substituted with the offset generated from the previous request's response (or if it's the first request, from 'http.initial.offset'). The parameters are only set if 'http.request.method' = `GET`.

config_defs.name: api12.http.request.body
config_defs.documentation: The payload to be sent along with each HTTP request. The value can be templated with offset (for example: ``search_after: ${offset}``) where ``${offset}`` will be substituted with the offset generated from the previous request's response (or if it's the first request, from 'http.initial.offset'). The body is only set if 'http.request.method' = `POST`.

config_defs.name: api12.http.offset.mode
config_defs.documentation: This config indicates how offsets are computed and how requests are generated. If set to ``SIMPLE_INCREMENTING``, the ${offset} used to generate requests is simply the previous offset (or ``http.initial.offset``) incremented by 1 per sourced record. In this mode, ``http.initial.offset`` needs to be set to an integer value. If set to ``CHAINING``, the config 'http.offset.json.pointer' needs to be set, and the offset for a record is set to the value for the configured key in the response data. If the value is ``CURSOR_PAGINATION``, then the config 'http.next.page.json.pointer' needs to be set and the offset for the last record in each page will be set to the next page value. If set to ``SNAPSHOT_PAGINATION``, only the config 'http.offset.json.pointer' needs to be set.

config_defs.name: api12.http.initial.offset
config_defs.documentation: The initial offset to be used to generate the first request. This needs to be set if either one or more of the configs - 'url', 'http.request.parameters', or 'http.request.body' contain the template variable ``${offset}``.

config_defs.name: api12.http.response.data.json.pointer
config_defs.documentation: The JSON Pointer to the entity in the JSON response containing the actual data that should be written to Kafka as records. The entity can be an array (multiple records in a single response) or an object / scalar value (single record).

config_defs.name: api12.http.offset.json.pointer
config_defs.documentation: The JSON Pointer to the value in each record that corresponds to the offset for that record (it is relative to 'http.response.data.json.pointer'). The offset will be available to the subsequent request as ${offset} and it will also be used for checkpointing and recovery in case of connector failures or restarts. This config should only be set if 'http.offset.mode' is set to ``CHAINING``.

config_defs.name: api12.http.next.page.json.pointer
config_defs.documentation: The JSON pointer to the value in the response which corresponds to the next page reference (either a page token, a full URL or a URL fragment). This will be stored as the offset and will be available to the subsequent request via the template variable ${offset}. This config should only be set if 'http.offset.mode' is set to ``CURSOR_PAGINATION``.

config_defs.name: api12.request.interval.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait between consecutive requests.

config_defs.documentation: HTTP response schema parsed from the swagger spec.

config_defs.name: connector.class
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your data?

config_defs.name: name
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your data?
config_defs.documentation: Sets a name for your connector.

config_defs.name: tasks.max
config_defs.group: Number of tasks for this connector
config_defs.documentation: Maximum number of tasks for the connector.

config_defs.name: kafka.auth.mode
config_defs.documentation: Kafka Authentication mode. It can be one of KAFKA_API_KEY or SERVICE_ACCOUNT. It defaults to KAFKA_API_KEY mode.

config_defs.name: kafka.api.key
config_defs.documentation: Kafka API Key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

connector_configs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
connector_configs.value: Placeholder value to pass connector validations

config_defs.name: error.topic.name
config_defs.documentation: Name of the error topic

config_defs.name: report.errors.as
config_defs.documentation: Dictates the content of records produced to the error topic. If set to ``Error string`` the value would be a human readable string describing the failure. The value will include some or all of the following information if available: http response code, reason phrase, submitted payload, url, response content, exception and error message. If set to http_response, the value would be the plain response content for the request which failed to write the record. In both modes, any information about the failure will also be included in the error records headers.

config_defs.name: http.api.base.url
config_defs.documentation: The HTTP API Base URL. For example: `http://example.com/absenceManagement/v1`.

config_defs.name: auth.type
config_defs.documentation: Authentication type of the endpoint. Valid values are ``NONE``, ``BASIC``, ``OAUTH2``, ``BEARER``

config_defs.name: connection.user
config_defs.documentation: The username to be used with an endpoint requiring basic authentication.

config_defs.name: connection.password
config_defs.documentation: The password to be used with an endpoint requiring basic authentication.

config_defs.name: bearer.token
config_defs.documentation: The bearer authentication token to be used with an endpoint requiring bearer token based authentication.

config_defs.name: oauth2.flow.type
config_defs.documentation: OAuth flow type to use for authenticating to the API endpoint

config_defs.name: oauth2.auth.endpoint
config_defs.documentation: The URL used to obtain an authorization code during the OAuth code grant flow

config_defs.name: oauth2.token.url
config_defs.documentation: The URL to be used for fetching the OAuth2 Access & Refresh Tokens.

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.id
config_defs.documentation: The client id used when fetching the OAuth2 token.

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.secret
config_defs.documentation: The client secret used when fetching the OAuth2 token.

config_defs.name: oauth2.token.property
config_defs.documentation: The name of the property containing the OAuth2 token returned by the OAuth2 token URL (defaults to `access_token`).

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.scope
config_defs.documentation: The scope parameter sent to the service when fetching the OAuth2 token.

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.auth.mode
config_defs.documentation: Specifies how to encode ``client_id`` and ``client_secret`` in the OAuth2 authorization request. If set to ``header``, the credentials are encoded as an `'Authorization: Basic <base-64 encoded client_id:client_secret>'` HTTP header. If set to 'url', then ``client_id`` and ``client_secret`` are sent as URL encoded parameters. If set to 'request_body', then ``client_id`` and ``client_secret`` are sent in the request body

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.headers
config_defs.documentation: HTTP headers to be included in the OAuth2 client endpoint. Individual headers should be separated by `|`

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.header.separator
config_defs.documentation: Separator character used in OAuth2 Client Headers

config_defs.name: oauth2.query.params
config_defs.documentation: OAuth query parameters.

config_defs.name: oauth2.auth.button
config_defs.documentation: Initiates the OAuth authentication flow.

config_defs.name: oauth2.refresh.token
config_defs.documentation: OAuth 2.0 refresh token.

config_defs.name: oauth2.session.id
config_defs.documentation: Connect OAuth Session ID.

config_defs.name: oauth.config.map
config_defs.documentation: Connect OAuth Config Map to map OAuth API parameters to ConfigDefs.

config_defs.name: gcp.credentials.json
config_defs.documentation: GCP service account JSON file.

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate and add JWT token to request. If selected, JWT token will be added as 'jwt_token' request param

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.keystore.path
config_defs.documentation: Keystore containing private key to use to sign JWT.

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: Password to access keystore

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: JWT keystore type

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.claimset
config_defs.documentation: JSON containing JWT claims

config_defs.name: https.ssl.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Controls whether to enforce TLSv1.3 for HTTPS connections. If false, the connector uses the JVM default TLS configuration (typically TLSv1.2). If true, TLSv1.3 is enforced. Note that, even when disabled, HTTPS connections still use TLS. This setting only controls TLS version enforcement.

config_defs.name: https.ssl.keystorefile
config_defs.documentation: The key store containing the server certificate.

config_defs.name: https.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file.

config_defs.name: https.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the private key in the key store file.

config_defs.name: https.ssl.truststorefile
config_defs.documentation: The trust store containing a server CA certificate.

config_defs.name: https.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation: The trust store password containing a server CA certificate.

config_defs.name: apis.num
config_defs.documentation: The number of http(s) APIs to configure. This value should be less than or equal to 15

config_defs.name: send.multiple.http.requests.per.api
config_defs.display_name: Send multiple HTTP requests per API
config_defs.documentation: Send multiple HTTP requests per API.

config_defs.name: behavior.on.error
config_defs.documentation: Error handling behavior setting for handling error response from HTTP requests.

config_defs.name: https.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The protocol to use for SSL connections

config_defs.name: api1.http.api.path
config_defs.documentation: The HTTP API path together with the 'http.api.base.url' will form the complete HTTP(S) URL. This path can be templated with offset information. For example: ``/resource1/${offset}`` where ``${offset}`` will be substituted with the offset generated from the previous request's response (or if it's the first request, from 'http.initial.offset').

config_defs.name: api1.http.request.headers
config_defs.documentation: HTTP headers to be included in each request. Header names and values should be separated by `:`. Distinct headers should be separated by `|`. For example: `From:abcxyz@confluent.io|Content-Length:348`.

config_defs.name: api1.http.connect.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established

config_defs.name: api1.http.request.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait for a request response from the server

config_defs.name: api1.max.retries
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of times to retry on errors before failing the task.

config_defs.name: api1.retry.backoff.policy
config_defs.documentation: The backoff policy to use in terms of retry - CONSTANT_VALUE or EXPONENTIAL_WITH_JITTER

config_defs.name: api1.retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation: The initial duration in milliseconds to wait following an error before a retry attempt is made. Subsequent backoff attempts can be a constant value or exponential with jitter (can be configured using api*.retry.backoff.policy parameter). Jitter adds randomness to the exponential backoff algorithm to prevent synchronized retries.

config_defs.name: api1.retry.on.status.codes
config_defs.documentation: Comma-separated list of HTTP status codes or range of codes to retry on. Ranges are specified with start and optional end code. Range boundaries are inclusive. For instance, 400- includes all codes greater than or equal to 400. 400-500 includes codes from 400 to 500, including 500. Multiple ranges and single codes can be specified together to achieve fine-grained control over retry behavior. For example, 404,408,500- will retry on 404 NOT FOUND, 408 REQUEST TIMEOUT, and all 5xx error codes. Note that some status codes will always be retried, such as unauthorized, timeouts and too many requests.

config_defs.name: api1.http.request.headers.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct headers in the config 'http.request.headers'.

config_defs.name: api1.http.request.parameters.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct request parameters in the config 'http.request.parameters'.

config_defs.name: api1.http.path.parameters
config_defs.documentation: HTTP path parameters to be added to the request. Parameter names and values should be separated by ``:``. Distinct parameters should be separated by ``|``. Parameter values can be templated with different template values like ``${key}``, ``${topic}``, ``${offset}`` or other field references from kafka record.

config_defs.name: api1.http.path.parameters.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct path parameters in the config `http.path.parameters`

config_defs.name: api7.test.api.topic
config_defs.documentation: Topic name to be used when invoking test api

config_defs.name: api7.http.request.sensitive.headers
config_defs.documentation: Sensitive HTTP headers to include in each request. Sensitive header names and values should be separated by ``:``. Distinct headers should be separated by ``|``. For example: ``From:abcxyz@confluent.io|Content-Length:348``. If a key is present in both regular and sensitive headers, the value in sensitive headers takes priority. This is a **CLI-only feature**.

config_defs.name: api8.http.api.path
config_defs.documentation: The HTTP API path together with the 'http.api.base.url' will form the complete HTTP(S) URL. This path can be templated with offset information. For example: ``/resource1/${offset}`` where ``${offset}`` will be substituted with the offset generated from the previous request's response (or if it's the first request, from 'http.initial.offset').

config_defs.name: api8.http.request.headers
config_defs.documentation: HTTP headers to be included in each request. Header names and values should be separated by `:`. Distinct headers should be separated by `|`. For example: `From:abcxyz@confluent.io|Content-Length:348`.

config_defs.name: api8.http.connect.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established

config_defs.name: api8.http.request.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait for a request response from the server

config_defs.name: api8.max.retries
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of times to retry on errors before failing the task.

config_defs.name: api8.retry.backoff.policy
config_defs.documentation: The backoff policy to use in terms of retry - CONSTANT_VALUE or EXPONENTIAL_WITH_JITTER

config_defs.name: api8.retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation: The initial duration in milliseconds to wait following an error before a retry attempt is made. Subsequent backoff attempts can be a constant value or exponential with jitter (can be configured using api*.retry.backoff.policy parameter). Jitter adds randomness to the exponential backoff algorithm to prevent synchronized retries.

config_defs.name: api8.retry.on.status.codes
config_defs.documentation: Comma-separated list of HTTP status codes or range of codes to retry on. Ranges are specified with start and optional end code. Range boundaries are inclusive. For instance, 400- includes all codes greater than or equal to 400. 400-500 includes codes from 400 to 500, including 500. Multiple ranges and single codes can be specified together to achieve fine-grained control over retry behavior. For example, 404,408,500- will retry on 404 NOT FOUND, 408 REQUEST TIMEOUT, and all 5xx error codes. Note that some status codes will always be retried, such as unauthorized, timeouts and too many requests.

config_defs.name: api8.http.request.headers.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct headers in the config 'http.request.headers'.

config_defs.name: api8.http.request.parameters.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct request parameters in the config 'http.request.parameters'.

config_defs.name: api8.http.path.parameters
config_defs.documentation: HTTP path parameters to be added to the request. Parameter names and values should be separated by ``:``. Distinct parameters should be separated by ``|``. Parameter values can be templated with different template values like ``${key}``, ``${topic}``, ``${offset}`` or other field references from kafka record.

config_defs.name: api8.http.path.parameters.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct path parameters in the config `http.path.parameters`

config_defs.name: api15.http.api.path
config_defs.documentation: The HTTP API path together with the 'http.api.base.url' will form the complete HTTP(S) URL. This path can be templated with offset information. For example: ``/resource1/${offset}`` where ``${offset}`` will be substituted with the offset generated from the previous request's response (or if it's the first request, from 'http.initial.offset').

config_defs.name: api15.http.request.headers
config_defs.documentation: HTTP headers to be included in each request. Header names and values should be separated by `:`. Distinct headers should be separated by `|`. For example: `From:abcxyz@confluent.io|Content-Length:348`.

config_defs.name: api15.http.connect.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established

config_defs.name: api15.http.request.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait for a request response from the server

config_defs.name: api15.max.retries
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of times to retry on errors before failing the task.

config_defs.name: api15.retry.backoff.policy
config_defs.documentation: The backoff policy to use in terms of retry - CONSTANT_VALUE or EXPONENTIAL_WITH_JITTER

config_defs.name: api15.retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation: The initial duration in milliseconds to wait following an error before a retry attempt is made. Subsequent backoff attempts can be a constant value or exponential with jitter (can be configured using api*.retry.backoff.policy parameter). Jitter adds randomness to the exponential backoff algorithm to prevent synchronized retries.

config_defs.name: api15.retry.on.status.codes
config_defs.documentation: Comma-separated list of HTTP status codes or range of codes to retry on. Ranges are specified with start and optional end code. Range boundaries are inclusive. For instance, 400- includes all codes greater than or equal to 400. 400-500 includes codes from 400 to 500, including 500. Multiple ranges and single codes can be specified together to achieve fine-grained control over retry behavior. For example, 404,408,500- will retry on 404 NOT FOUND, 408 REQUEST TIMEOUT, and all 5xx error codes. Note that some status codes will always be retried, such as unauthorized, timeouts and too many requests.

config_defs.name: api15.http.request.headers.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct headers in the config 'http.request.headers'.

config_defs.name: api15.http.request.parameters.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct request parameters in the config 'http.request.parameters'.

config_defs.name: api15.http.path.parameters
config_defs.documentation: HTTP path parameters to be added to the request. Parameter names and values should be separated by ``:``. Distinct parameters should be separated by ``|``. Parameter values can be templated with different template values like ``${key}``, ``${topic}``, ``${offset}`` or other field references from kafka record.

config_defs.name: api15.http.path.parameters.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character that separates multiple distinct path parameters in the config `http.path.parameters`

config_defs.name: api15.test.api
config_defs.documentation: Flag to determine if the api needs to be tested

config_defs.name: api15.test.api.http.request.body
config_defs.documentation: Test request body to be used when invoking test api

config_defs.name: api15.test.api.offset
config_defs.documentation: Initial offset to be used when invoking test api

config_defs.name: api15.test.api.topic
config_defs.documentation: Topic name to be used when invoking test api

config_defs.name: api15.http.request.sensitive.headers
config_defs.documentation: Sensitive HTTP headers to include in each request. Sensitive header names and values should be separated by ``:``. Distinct headers should be separated by ``|``. For example: ``From:abcxyz@confluent.io|Content-Length:348``. If a key is present in both regular and sensitive headers, the value in sensitive headers takes priority. This is a **CLI-only feature**.

config_defs.name: kafka.service.account.id
config_defs.documentation: The Service Account that will be used to generate the API keys to communicate with Kafka Cluster.

config_defs.name: kafka.api.secret
config_defs.documentation: Secret associated with Kafka API key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

config_defs.name: datapreview.schemas.enable
config_defs.display_name: Show schemas in data preview request output
config_defs.documentation:
This config key only applies to data preview requests and governs whether the data preview output has record schema with it.
The visibility condition is set such that it can never be true.
So this key does not show in create connector UI.

config_defs.name: errors.tolerance
config_defs.documentation: Use this property if you would like to configure the connector's error handling behavior. WARNING: This property should be used with CAUTION for SOURCE CONNECTORS as it may lead to dataloss. If you set this property to 'all', the connector will not fail on errant records, but will instead log them (and send to DLQ for Sink Connectors) and continue processing. If you set this property to 'none', the connector task will fail on errant records.

config_defs.name: producer.override.linger.ms
config_defs.documentation: The producer groups together any records that arrive in between request transmissions into a single batched request. More details can be found in the documentation: https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/installation/configuration/producer-configs.html#linger-ms.

config_defs.name: csfle.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Determines whether the connector honours CSFLE rules or not

metadata.group_description: Enable client-side encryption for the data that is stored in Confluent Cloud. Encryption rule must be setup for the data to be encrypted. Learn more

config_defs.name: sr.service.account.id
config_defs.documentation: Select the service account that has appropriate permissions to schemas and encryption keys in the Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: schema.context.name
config_defs.documentation: Add a schema context name. A schema context represents an independent scope in Schema Registry. It is a separate sub-schema tied to topics in different Kafka clusters that share the same Schema Registry instance. If not used, the connector uses the default schema configured for Schema Registry in your Confluent Cloud environment.

config_defs.name: output.data.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the output Kafka record value format. Valid entries are AVRO, JSON_SR, or PROTOBUF. Please configure Confluent Cloud Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: value.converter.ignore.default.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: When set to true, this property ensures that the corresponding record in Kafka is NULL, instead of showing the default column value. Applicable for AVRO,PROTOBUF and JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.scrub.invalid.names
config_defs.documentation: Whether to scrub invalid names by replacing invalid characters with valid characters. Applicable for Avro and Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: auto.restart.on.user.error
config_defs.documentation: Enable connector to automatically restart on user-actionable errors.

config_defs.name: value.converter.enhanced.avro.schema.support
config_defs.documentation: Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information and Enums. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.connect.meta.data
config_defs.documentation: Allow the Connect converter to add its metadata to the output schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.enhanced.protobuf.schema.support
config_defs.documentation: Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.generate.index.for.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate an index suffix for unions. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.int.for.enums
config_defs.documentation: Whether to represent enums as integers. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.optional.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: Whether nullable fields should be specified with an optional label. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.generate.struct.for.nulls
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate a struct variable for null values. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.wrapper.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: Whether nullable fields should use primitive wrapper messages. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.wrapper.for.raw.primitives
config_defs.documentation: Whether a wrapper message should be interpreted as a raw primitive at root level. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.object.additional.properties
config_defs.documentation: Whether to allow additional properties for object schemas. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.use.optional.for.nonrequired
config_defs.documentation: Whether to set non-required properties to be optional. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.decimal.format
config_defs.documentation:
Specify the JSON/JSON_SR serialization format for Connect DECIMAL logical type values with two allowed literals:
BASE64 to serialize DECIMAL logical types as base64 encoded binary data and
NUMERIC to serialize Connect DECIMAL logical type values in JSON/JSON_SR as a number representing the decimal value.

config_defs.name: value.converter.auto.register.schemas
config_defs.documentation: Specify if the Serializer should attempt to register the Schema.

config_defs.name: value.converter.use.latest.version
config_defs.documentation: Use latest version of schema in subject for serialization when auto.register.schemas is false.

config_defs.name: value.converter.latest.compatibility.strict
config_defs.documentation: Verify latest subject version is backward compatible when `use.latest.version` is `true`.

config_defs.name: key.converter.key.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: How to construct the subject name for key schema registration.

config_defs.name: value.converter.value.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: Determines how to construct the subject name under which the value schema is registered with Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: value.converter.reference.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: Set the subject reference name strategy for value. Valid entries are DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy or QualifiedReferenceSubjectNameStrategy. Note that the subject reference name strategy can be selected only for PROTOBUF format with the default strategy being DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy.

config_defs.name: value.converter.allow.optional.map.keys
config_defs.documentation: Allow optional string map key when converting from Connect Schema to Avro Schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.flatten.singleton.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to flatten singleton unions. Applicable for Avro and JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.optional.for.proto2
config_defs.documentation: Whether proto2 optionals are supported. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.flatten.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to flatten unions (oneofs). Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: header.converter
config_defs.documentation: The converter class for the headers. This is used to serialize and deserialize the headers of the messages.
